titleInfo.title: Dairy Farm of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''# 804 JCRS postcard packet, c 1950''. Printed on bottom of photograph: ''A part of the Sanatorium's pure bred Holstein herd.''

mods.abstract: Postcard of the dairy farm and purebred Holstein herd at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). This postcard is from a set of photographs of the JCRS. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue, just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
